instantiate.title: InstantiateMsg
instantiate.description: This structure describes the basic parameters for creating a contract.

lp_token_addr.description: The LP contract address which can be staked in the reward_contract

pair_addr.description: The pair contract address used in this generator proxy

Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

AssetInfo.description: This enum describes available Token types.

execute.title: ExecuteMsg
execute.description: This structure describes the execute messages available in the contract.

oneOf.description: Withdraw pending token rewards from the 3rd party staking contract
Withdraw LP tokens and outstanding token rewards

account.description: The address that will receive the withdrawn tokens and rewards

amount.description: The amount of LP tokens to withdraw

oneOf.description: Withdraw LP tokens without claiming rewards

account.description: The address that will receive the withdrawn tokens

amount.description: The amount of LP tokens to withdraw

Addr.description:
A human readable address.

In Cosmos, this is typically bech32 encoded. But for multi-chain smart contracts no assumptions should be made other than being UTF-8 encoded and of reasonable length.

This type represents a validated address. It can be created in the following ways 1. Use `Addr::unchecked(input)` 2. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_validate(input)?` 3. Use `let checked: Addr = deps.api.addr_humanize(canonical_addr)?` 4. Deserialize from JSON. This must only be done from JSON that was validated before such as a contract's state. `Addr` must not be used in messages sent by the user because this would result in unvalidated instances.

This type is immutable. If you really need to mutate it (Really? Are you sure?), create a mutable copy using `let mut mutable = Addr::to_string()` and operate on that `String` instance.

Binary.description:
Binary is a wrapper around Vec<u8> to add base64 de/serialization with serde. It also adds some helper methods to help encode inline.

This is only needed as serde-json-{core,wasm} has a horrible encoding for Vec<u8>. See also <https://github.com/CosmWasm/cosmwasm/blob/main/docs/MESSAGE_TYPES.md>.

CallbackMsg.description: This structure describes the callback messages available in the contract.

prev_lp_balance.description: The previous LP balance for the contract. This is used to calculate the amount of received LP tokens after withdrawing from a third party contract

Cw20ReceiveMsg.description: Cw20ReceiveMsg should be de/serialized under `Receive()` variant in a ExecuteMsg

query.title: QueryMsg
query.description: This structure describes query messages available in the contract.

oneOf.description: Returns the amount of deposited LP tokens
Returns the amount of rewards to be distributed
Returns the amount of pending rewards which can be claimed right now
Returns the 3rd party reward token info

migrate.title: MigrateMsg
migrate.description: This structure describes a migration message. We currently take no arguments for migrations

deposit.title: Uint128

pending_token.title: PendingTokenResponse
pending_token.description: This structure holds the response returned when querying the amount of pending rewards that can be withdrawn from a 3rd party rewards contract

reward.title: Uint128

reward_info.title: AssetInfo
reward_info.description: This enum describes available Token types.
